text: The yobibyte is a multiple of the unit byte for digital information. It is a member of the set of units with binary prefixes defined by the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC). Its unit symbol is YiB. The prefix yobi (symbol Yi) represents multiplication by 10248, therefore: : 1 yobibyte = 280 bytes = = zebibytes The prefixes zebi and yobi were added to the system of binary prefixes in August 2005.News & views from the IEC June 2012 One yobibyte (1 YiB) is equal to eight yobibits (8 Yibit). ==See also== * IEC 80000-13 * IEEE 1541 * Orders of magnitude (data) * SI prefix ==References== Category:Units of information
title: Yobibyte
